name: 2-pyridineacetamide
Reason: 2-Pyridineacetamide is a compound with a pyridine ring and an acetamide group. The pyridine ring is a heterocyclic aromatic ring with a nitrogen atom, which can increase the melting point due to its aromaticity and the ability to form hydrogen bonds. The acetamide group is a functional group that can also participate in hydrogen bonding, which increases the melting point. The melting point of 2-pyridineacetamide can be estimated by considering the melting points of its constituent parts. The melting point of pyridine is 25.3 °C, and the melting point of acetamide is 82.0 °C. The melting point of 2-pyridineacetamide is expected to be higher than both due to the combined effects of the pyridine ring and the acetamide group. The increase in melting point due to the pyridine ring is estimated to be around 10-15 °C, while the increase due to the acetamide group is estimated to be around 20-25 °C. The combined effect is estimated to be around 30-40 °C, resulting in a predicted melting point of approximately 112-122 °C.
